comments.body: there are a lot fewer comments in this file than in the main template's pubspec.yaml, is that intended?

This is intentional: I thought it's okay since this template is focused on intermediate users who "just want to start an app". But I don't have a strong opinion here, and can easily revert back. Let me know.

> Aside: When the comments are back, 95% of the lines in this file are the same as in the main template (we're just actually using `assets:` here). I was looking at ways to make this DRY, but it would just make bind this new template to `create_base.dart` with something like [`withPluginHook`](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/34059eec2c671472ee95f5093705fb9fed0b3919/packages/flutter_tools/lib/src/commands/create_base.dart#L368).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@  assets:
    # Add assets from the images directory to the application.
    - assets/images/
